sentence.Network_en: He took out a sheaf of papers and leafed through them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他拿出一沓报纸，匆匆翻阅了一下。

sentence.Network_en: I leafed through the catalog and found nothing interesting.
sentence.Network_cn: 我翻了翻目录,没看到什么有趣的东西.

PerfectNetExp.abs: leafage 叶子leafed 有叶子的leafhopper 叶蝉

this paper makes a survey on the leafed plants species and landscape application in botanical gardens , parks , main roads , universities and squares within the fifth ring road of Beijing .对北京市区五环内主要的植物园、公园、城市主干道、高校及广场的彩叶植物种类及其在园林中的应用进行了调查和分析。
also , some suggestions concerning to the introduction , species selection and application of leafed plants in Beijing city are put forward in this paper .最后对北京园林彩叶植物的引种、选择和应用提出建议。

entry.def: The leaves of a tree or plant are the parts that are flat, thin, and usually green. Many trees and plants lose their leaves in the winter and grow new leaves in the spring.

example.ex: In the garden, the leaves of the horse chestnut had already fallen...
example.tran: 花园里，七叶树已经落叶了。

example.ex: The Japanese maple that stands across the drive had just come into leaf.
example.tran: 车道对面那棵鸡爪枫刚吐新叶。

entry.def: A leaf is one of the pieces of paper of which a book is made.

example.ex: He flattened the wrappers and put them between the leaves of his book.
example.tran: 他把包装纸压平，夹在书里。

entry.tran: 师法；效法；以（某人）为榜样
entry.def: If you take a leaf from someone's book you behave in the same way as them because you want to be like that person or as successful as they are.

example.ex: Maybe we should take a leaf out of Branson's book. It's easy to see how he became a billionaire...
example.tran: 也许我们应该效法布兰森。我们都不难看出他是怎样成为亿万富翁的。

entry.tran: 重新开始；洗心革面；改过自新
entry.def: If you say that you are going to turn over a new leaf, you mean that you are going to start to behave in a better or more acceptable way.

example.ex: He realized he was in the wrong and promised to turn over a new leaf.
example.tran: 他认识到自己错了，答应改过自新。

entry.tran: （因寒冷、恐惧等）浑身发抖，抖如落叶
entry.def: If you say that someone is shaking like a leaf, you mean that their body is shaking a lot, for instance because they are very cold or frightened.

example.ex: I didn't think about the danger at the time. Afterwards I was shaking like a leaf.
example.tran: 我那时候没想到有危险，事后我吓得直发抖。

means.word_mean: 1. having leaves or leaves as specified; often used in combination;

auth_sentence.content: One of the things the book notes is that it's meant to be portable and leafed through and covered with coffee stains.

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Xi opened the album, smiled broadly, and leafed through each page, naming every Chinese official accompanying his father.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr. Xi opened the album, smiled broadly, and leafed through each page, naming every Chinese official accompanying his father.

auth_sentence.content: I'll find out soon when everything has fully leafed out whether my trim jobs were smart or whether some were mistakes.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'll find out soon when everything has fully leafed out whether my trim jobs were smart or whether some were mistakes.
